titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn public improvements collection 1977.314
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:39:17 +0000.

did.abstract: This collection includes contracts, specifications, and public notices for various public improvement projects in Brooklyn throughout the period circa 1830 to 1880, including paving and repairing streets, repairing and installing lampposts, renovating City Hall, and building cisterns, among others. Most of the materials are from the Brooklyn Street Commissioners, while others are from the Brooklyn Common Council and its various committees.
